```{python}

import polars as pl
import polars.selectors as cs 
from great_tables import GT, loc, style

```

Get the data from google scholar

```{python}
#| include: false

df = (
    pl.read_csv("citations.csv")
    .select(["Year", "Title", "Publication", "Authors"])
    .rename({"Publication": "Venue"})
    .sort(by="Year", descending=True)
    .with_columns(
        (pl.col("Venue").str.to_titlecase())
    )
)
print(df)

```



```{python}

gt1 = GT(df)

gt1

```



```{python}

gt2 = (
    gt1
    .tab_header(title="Published Works")
)

gt2

```



```{python}

gt3 = (
    gt2
    .tab_style(
        style=style.text(weight="italic"),
    locations=loc.body(columns="Venue"))

)

gt3

```
